title: 113_s1001
content: The "Iran Export Embargo Act" is cited as the short title. The Iran Freedom and Counter-Proliferation Act of 2012 is amended to impose sanctions on the government of Iran. The Government of Iran is found to violate human rights and sponsor terrorism, including involvement in various terrorist activities. Iran also defies UN Security Council Resolutions regarding nuclear activities. The Government of Iran violates UN Security Council Resolutions by refusing to suspend nuclear activities, developing ballistic missiles, transferring arms to terrorist groups, supporting human rights abuses in Syria. The Government of Iran supports terrorist groups in Gaza and aids human rights abuses in Syria. The President is required to block property and transactions involving individuals involved in these activities. The President is mandated to impose sanctions on foreign financial institutions that knowingly conduct significant transactions related to the importation, sale, or transfer of goods or services from Iran on behalf of specified individuals. Sanctions will also be imposed on individuals who import, purchase, or transfer goods or services from those described in subsection (f). Additionally, sanctions will be imposed on individuals involved in insurance and reinsurance transactions with Iran. The President will impose sanctions on individuals providing insurance or reinsurance services to those involved in transactions with Iran, unless due diligence is exercised in preventing such activities. The President will impose sanctions on individuals providing insurance or reinsurance services to entities associated with Iran, including the Government of Iran and its affiliates. Sanctions apply regardless of public listing, emphasizing the need for diligence in enforcing policies to prevent such transactions. The text describes the imposition of sanctions on individuals providing insurance or reinsurance services to entities associated with Iran, regardless of public listing. Additionally, it states that subsections (c) and (d) will apply to the exportation, importation, sale, or transfer of crude oil from Iran after a specified date.
